intro: Piper pubiovarium, commonly known as the hairy soursop, is a tropical vine belonging to the Piperaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into fleshy, spiny fruits resembling a soursop. The fruit contains a single large, inedible seed surrounded by a sweet, aromatic pulp. It is native to Central and South America and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties.
